Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
The Marketing department aims to encourage the world to be as enthusiastic about our products as we are. We have more than twenty different teams with specific areas of focus. Our teams are sharp, highly skilled, and data-driven, focusing on customer acquisition and monetization initiatives.

Main Responsibilities

  • Work mainly on SEO and Paid channels data;
  • Help to define and calculate KPIs and key metrics for the teams, monitor them in automated reports and dashboards;
  • Analyse users and product to find new business opportunities and areas for improvement;
  • Execute ad-hoc analyses;
  • Present insights to SEO, Paid teams;
  • Build, support and replicate data structures (including database structures, table building, reporting, data visualization, regression analysis, time series, etc.)




Core Requirements

  • Experience in e-commerce, SaaS or digital marketing environment;
  • Solid understanding and experience of SQL (Google BigQuery as an advantage) and Python or R (for data modeling and general development);
  • Strong communication skills, a proactive approach, analytical problem-solving abilities, and a collaborative mindset, being an effective and versatile team player;
  • Experience with Google Analytics;
  • Proven experience with various data visualization and statistical analysis methods;
  • Experience with a/b testing analysis is a plus




Salary Range


  • Gross Salary 2980-4300 EUR/Month




About Us
Nord Security is a global leader in internet privacy and security solutions and Lithuania’s second tech unicorn. Established in 2012, Nord Security now has more than 1400 employees and serves millions of users worldwide. Our team has a global mission to shape a more secure and peaceful online future for people everywhere. With that in mind, we built several advanced cybersecurity solutions: NordVPN, NordLayer, NordLocker, NordPass, NordProtect, NordStellar, and Saily.

NordVPN is the world’s most advanced VPN service provider, used by millions of internet users worldwide. NordVPN provides double VPN encryption and Onion Over VPN and guarantees privacy with zero tracking. One of the key features of the product is Threat Protection, which blocks malicious websites, malware, trackers, and ads. NordVPN is very user friendly, offers one of the best prices on the market, and has over 5,000 servers in 59 countries worldwide.

And we’re always looking to expand our team of:


  • Future shapers
  • Restless achievers
  • Self-movers
  • Honest communicators
  • Team players




What We Offer

  • Access to Nord Security products. We build solutions used by millions of users worldwide, and you’ll get to experience our products firsthand, at no charge;
  • Professional growth. Internal and external events, online training, conferences, books - everything you need to reach full potential;
  • Health benefits. Private health insurance, sports access card, online workouts, consultations, programs to improve mental health to feel and be your best;
  • Mental wellbeing. Access to mental health tools like Calm, Headspace, and Mindletic. Options for therapy to keep your emotional wellbeing in check;
  • Team spirit. Team buildings and parties with games, shows, tastings, food coupons, gifts, and it’s on us;
  • Additional paid leave. Additional days are covered by us in cases of illness or special occasions;
  • Flexibility. Flexible working time arrangement




Kindly refer to our Privacy Notice for Recruitment Candidates for comprehensive information regarding our data handling procedures throughout recruitment processes: https://bit.ly/3urJdOL

Title: Junior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
HTML:
A AdvanceCare, plataforma especializada na gestão de seguros e planos de saúde, pretende reforçar a sua equipa com novos talentos para integrar uma cultura organizacional dinâmica e inovadora.


Integrado na área de Gestão de Produto, terá como principais responsabilidades:

  • Desenho de modelos preditivos de negócio;
  • Implementar soluções de reporting;
  • Desenvolver relatórios de acompanhamento da evolução do comportamento da carteira;
  • Desenvolver métodos de cálculo adequados para projeção de custos, garantindo a credibilidade dos resultados;
  • Preparar informação/ documentação de suporte para tomada de decisão.


Perfil:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado nas áreas de matemática ou ciências atuariais;
  • Conhecimento de análise de dados;
  • Capacidade analítica e de planeamento;
  • Dinamismo e proatividade;
  • Pensamento crítico.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!

At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.

Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team:


Competitive compensation for your work
Emphasis on work/life balance
Collaborative and team-oriented environment
Opportunities for professional growth
Diversity and Inclusion
Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


Job Description

In this role, you will be part of a small, entrepreneurial, and agile global team that is focused on leveraging data, analytics and technology at scale to accelerate the growth of our core products in key geographies. We work closely and collaboratively, meeting at the office every working day to connect in-person, problem-solve, and iterate quickly to drive results.

You will have plenty of opportunities to collaborate with colleagues from around the world and make a tangible difference to help bring our innovative products to more patients faster.

Key Responsibilities


As a Data Analyst, you will be working with data from various sources across the company to continue to deepen our understanding of what drives the company’s performance, explore innovative angles to systematically look at & drive our business, and surface opportunities that will help propel Sobi’s growth journey.
You will generate insights with the potential to be leveraged at all levels of the organization – from CEO to business leaders in our affiliates globally.
You will also play an important role in designing & developing digital solutions to equip our field force, power their decision making and enable their agility, bringing your analytical work to life at scale across the company.


Reporting to: Analytics Manager, Strategy Implementation and Global Data & Analytics.

Qualifications

About you

As a person, you should be a team player driven to make a tangible contribution to the company, and be able to manage and prioritize between multiple workstreams depending on business opportunities which could change quickly.

You should be curious, eager to continuously grow and to constantly push the data & analytics envelope and help the company reach its next level(s).

In addition, you must demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership.


A top tier university degree in a relevant field (e.g. economics, business, science, or engineering)
Applicable work experience (1-3 years) from data analytics and data visualization (pharma/healthcare industry experience is a plus)
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, advanced formulas, VBA)
A good understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation using a programming language (preferably R)
Proficiency with a visualization tool (preferably QlikSense)
Strong interpersonal and communication skills in verbal and written English (Swedish is not required)


Additional Information

Why Join Us?

Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team:


Competitive compensation for your work
Emphasis on work/life balance
Collaborative and team-oriented environment
Opportunities for professional growth
Diversity and Inclusion
Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


We are a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.

We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.

Sobi Culture

At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.

As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¡En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!




Somos una empresa estratégica internacional de servicios tecnológicos, comprometida esencialmente con su equipo y con la sociedad. Ofrecemos soluciones en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, de electrónica, y proyectos de I+D. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades, promoviendo su desarrollo profesional y personal.




Misión: Como Data Analyst, serás responsable de construir y gestionar soluciones de monitorización que abarcan el rendimiento de aplicaciones, eventos LOG y KPI BAU. Tu misión será desarrollar pipelines de datos con PySpark, crear cubos tabulares usando Analysis Services (DAX) y diseñar cuadros de mando efectivos con Power BI. Deberás evaluar las necesidades, coordinar con equipos de terceros y asegurar la implementación de medidas de seguridad y control de acceso, con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad del servicio y proporcionar información valiosa a través de soluciones de datos robustas.




Nuestro perfil ideal cuenta con:

Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en la construcción y gestión de pipelines de datos.
Experiencia práctica en Databricks, Azure Analysis Services y Power BI.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de pipelines de datos utilizando PySpark.
Capacidad para crear cubos tabulares con Analysis Services (DAX).
Habilidad para diseñar cuadros de mando utilizando Power BI.




Además, en K-LAGAN, queremos que disfrutes de toda la experiencia completa de ser parte de nuestro equipo, por ello ofrecemos:




¡IMPRESCINDIBLE! Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable.
MODALIDAD: Trabajo Híbrido - Madrid, modelo híbrido de 2 días en oficina.
TEAM BUILDING: Barbacoas, cafés tecnológicos e igual este año se nos ocurren más cosas para estar más cerca de vosotros.
SEGUIMIENTO CONTINUO: contarás con nuestros fantásticos TBM para seguir creciendo y tener feedback sobre tu desempeño y día a día.

HTML:
¡En K-LAGAN te estamos esperando para continuar creciendo juntos!


Somos una empresa estratégica internacional de servicios tecnológicos, comprometida esencialmente con su equipo y con la sociedad. Ofrecemos soluciones en servicios IT, desarrollos de ingeniería, de electrónica, y proyectos de I+D. Nuestro compromiso es contratar a los mejores talentos independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades, promoviendo su desarrollo profesional y personal.


Misión: Como Data Analyst, serás responsable de construir y gestionar soluciones de monitorización que abarcan el rendimiento de aplicaciones, eventos LOG y KPI BAU. Tu misión será desarrollar pipelines de datos con PySpark, crear cubos tabulares usando Analysis Services (DAX) y diseñar cuadros de mando efectivos con Power BI. Deberás evaluar las necesidades, coordinar con equipos de terceros y asegurar la implementación de medidas de seguridad y control de acceso, con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad del servicio y proporcionar información valiosa a través de soluciones de datos robustas.


Nuestro perfil ideal cuenta con:

  • Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en la construcción y gestión de pipelines de datos.
  • Experiencia práctica en Databricks, Azure Analysis Services y Power BI.
  • Experiencia en el desarrollo de pipelines de datos utilizando PySpark.
  • Capacidad para crear cubos tabulares con Analysis Services (DAX).
  • Habilidad para diseñar cuadros de mando utilizando Power BI.


Además, en K-LAGAN, queremos que disfrutes de toda la experiencia completa de ser parte de nuestro equipo, por ello ofrecemos:


  • ¡IMPRESCINDIBLE! Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable.
  • MODALIDAD: Trabajo Híbrido - Madrid, modelo híbrido de 2 días en oficina.
  • TEAM BUILDING: Barbacoas, cafés tecnológicos e igual este año se nos ocurren más cosas para estar más cerca de vosotros.
  • SEGUIMIENTO CONTINUO: contarás con nuestros fantásticos TBM para seguir creciendo y tener feedback sobre tu desempeño y día a día.

Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London

• Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training

• Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit

• An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Analyze assets including commercial real estate loans, residential mortgages, auto loans and other cash-flow generating assets

• Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings

• Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems

• Provide senior management with monthly, quarterly and annual updates on the lending portfolio

• Conduct market and asset level research




You have:




• BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)

• 0-3 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm

• Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)

• Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset

• Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English




Team profile:




Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (“DLG”) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.

DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.




About Morgan Stanley




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Dedichiamo tempo e cura alla valorizzazione del tuo talento, investiamo nelle tue competenze e diamo spazio alla tua voglia di metterti alla prova e fare la differenza. Se vuoi crescere insieme a ONIT verso l'obiettivo di essere il miglior partner nell'innovazione digitale, entra a far parte del nostro team!

La certificazione Great Place to Work conferma il nostro impegno per un ambiente lavorativo in cui il benessere e lo sviluppo delle persone sono la priorità, tanto quanto la soddisfazione dei clienti.




Profilo ricercato:




Ricerchiamo una figura di Data Analyst qualificata e proattiva. La persona ideale ha 1-2 anni di esperienza e ha conseguito la Laurea in Informatica o discipline STEM.

Si occuperà di analisi dei requisiti, progettazione e realizzazione di ambienti interattivi per l'analisi dati e creazione di strati semantici per facilitare l’accesso ai dati, anche da parte di utenti non tecnici. Sarà coinvolta in studi di fattibilità, confronto di soluzioni e stima dei benefici, garantendo la copertura funzionale.

Dovrà inoltre produrre documentazione, manuali utente e formare il personale, anche con training on the job. Infine, parteciperà alla sperimentazione di nuovi prodotti, sviluppo di prototipi e valutazione delle nuove tecnologie attraverso analisi costi/benefici.




Skills tecniche:

Modellazione dati di tipo normalizzato per basi dati operazionali e modelli dati per il data warehouse, metodologia e modelli OLAP e ROLAP, tecniche di analisi multidimensionale, linguaggio SQL
Conoscenza di tematiche applicative, best practice e metodologie di analisi, disegno e test in ambito data warehouse, business intelligence e analytics
Conoscenza della piattaforma Qlik Sense per l’analisi e l'elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistica, la realizzazione di strati semantici per l'accesso ai dati da parte di utenti non specialisti
Conoscenza della piattaforma MS Power BI per l’analisi e l'elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistica, la realizzazione di strati semantici per l'accesso ai dati da parte di utenti non specialisti.




Soft skills:

Capacità di lavorare in team e comunicare efficacemente
Capacità analitiche e problem-solving
Curiosità e propensione all’apprendimento costante
Precisione e orientamento all’obiettivo




Cosa offriamo:

Possibilità di smart-working
Flessibilità oraria
Ambiente di lavoro giovane, collaborativo ed innovativo
Academy interna e possibilità di crescita professionale




Essere parte di Onit vuol dire abbracciare valori come onestà, rispetto, equità, trasparenza, fiducia e responsabilità. Questi pilastri sono alla base delle nostre relazioni interne, creando un ambiente in cui ognuno può esercitare la propria attività in modo responsabile e flessibile.

Se ti riconosci nei nostri valori, candidati ora. Ti contatteremo per un primo colloquio conoscitivo o conserveremo il tuo CV per opportunità future.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.

To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...

Job Details

Data Analyst

Join our Unified Marketing Measurement team as a Data Analyst!

In this role, you will use innovative data analytics and data science technology, evolve your skills, and provide our clients with the best-in-class analytical solutions.

We are seeking candidates with experience in a data-related role, open to develop in some programming (SQL) and data modelling techniques.

What You’ll Do…


Data Analysis and Processing: process and validate data sets provided by clients (sales, marketing, price, promotional activities and external / macroeconomic factors).
Analytics and Machine Learning: run marketing mix models with usage of Kantar internal modelling platform to discover patterns and rules determining clients’ sales success and identify weaknesses and bugs in models for resolution.
Internal Collaboration: communicate results of data analysis / modelling to Kantar CS teams, implement feedback from CS teams to improve quality of input data / modelling results.
External Communication: communicate technical information with both technical and non-technical team members and collaborators (also clients).


What You’ll Bring…


Strong numerical skills and exceptional attention to detail required to analyse/transform complex data sets and combine data from different sources.
Some experience with data-related technologies, including database queries, data analysis and eagerness to develop new skills.
Experience in Excel.
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on logical thinking and critical analysis.
Previous experience with MMM solutions (tools / methods) is welcome but not required.


WHY JOIN KANTAR?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Kantar Rewards Statement

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Location

Warsaw, Plac KoneseraPoland

Kantar Rewards Statement

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Data Analyst




Location - Amsterdam, Netherlandss




Job Description:




Your competencies and experience

• A master’s degree in the field of analytics, mathematics or econometrics

• You have experience with querying languages (e.g., SQL, SAS), and preferably also with dashboarding tools (e.g., Cognos, PowerBI)

• You are analytically strong and have experience in making analyses and sharing results with impact

• You are able to transform data into insights, and present them in an understandable way

• You have a can-do mentality, and you like to quickly learn and apply new techniques

• You are customer-oriented and have experience in using customer and other data to substantiate your decisions

• You can manage stakeholders at different levels, including data oriented and business experts

• You actively ask for help and feedback and you dare to give feedback

Experience with the agile way of working is beneficial for this role.

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
The Company

KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics







Your role at KIKO MILANO

We are looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join KIKO MILANO’s Transformation team, reporting to the Data Analytics Senior Manager.




Such talent will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design and develop BI solutions and provide analytical support.

Your expertise will be crucial in helping the company make data-driven decisions, optimize processes, and identify growth opportunities.




In particular, you will:




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights and support decision-making;
Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms;
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements;
Design and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively;
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support strategic initiatives;
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and BI technologies;
Provide training and support to end-users to ensure they can effectively use BI tools and understand insights.







What you will need to succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role.
Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar.
Strong SQL skills and experience with data querying and manipulation.
Experience with programming languages such as Python is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus.







We would love if you had

Excellent communication and influencing skills with experience of building relationships across an organisation
Strong organisational skills with an ability to re- prioritise as required to meet deadlines
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Highly collaborative style and willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams







KIKO si impegna ad ampliare i propri sforzi per garantire le Pari Opportunità e dedica una particolare attenzione all’integrazione delle persone con disabilità all’interno dell’azienda. Tutte le posizioni aperte in KIKO sono rivolte anche ai candidati appartenenti alle Categorie Protette l.68/99. I dati verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca del Personale. Leggi l'informativa privacy riportata al link https://static.kikocosmetics.com/public/HR/PrivacyCandidati.pdf

  • Strong organisational skills with an ability to re- prioritise as required to meet deadlines
  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment
  • Highly collaborative style and willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams



KIKO si impegna ad ampliare i propri sforzi per garantire le Pari Opportunità e dedica una particolare attenzione all’integrazione delle persone con disabilità all’interno dell’azienda. Tutte le posizioni aperte in KIKO sono rivolte anche ai candidati appartenenti alle Categorie Protette l.68/99. I dati verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca del Personale. Leggi l'informativa privacy riportata al link https://static.kikocosmetics.com/public/HR/PrivacyCandidati.pdf

Title: Data Analyst | Lisboa
Description:
A Decskill nasceu em 2014 como uma Empresa de Consultoria em Tecnologia da Informação e com a premissa que o seu maior ativo são as suas pessoas. Com o propósito de criar valor através do conhecimento e do talento, a Decskill promove uma cultura de excelência e investe no desenvolvimento e bem-estar dos colaboradores. Com mais de 600 profissionais dedicados e escritórios em Lisboa, Porto, Madrid e Luxemburgo, a Decskill atua hoje em três áreas de negócio:




• Decskill Talent: Acreditamos que as nossas pessoas são fundamentais para o nosso sucesso de todos. Através da Decskill Talent, capacitamos e acompanhamos equipas em desafios da transformação digital dos nossos clientes. Colaboramos com os clientes na sua estratégia de transição digital e inovação, garantindo o sucesso do projeto e o crescimento do negócio.




• Decskill Boost: O nosso compromisso com o talento estende-se a novos modelos de desenvolvimento e colaboração. Dotando a nossa equipa com as mais recentes ferramentas, metodologias e melhores práticas, otimizamos o Time-to-Market e entregamos soluções inovadoras que superam expectativas do cliente.




• Decskill Connect: Na Decskill Connect, a equipa Decskill colabora de perto com os clientes para implementar e gerir infraestruturas de tecnologia da informação que geram valor a longo prazo.




O sucesso da Decskill é construído pelo foco nas nossas pessoas e pela capacidade de enfrentar os desafios da transformação digital com agilidade e flexibilidade. Criamos valor não só para os nossos clientes, mas também para todo o nosso ecossistema onde fomentamos uma comunidade digital dedicada ao crescimento dos negócios através da tecnologia.




Procuramos um Data Analyst para um projeto híbrido em Lisboa.




Responsabilidades:

Criar reports e relatórios técnicos e funcionais;
Capacidade de sintetizar informações e efetuar a transformação, consolidação e simplificação de fontes de dados.




Requisitos:

Experiência prévia na função;
Experiência com SQL para extração de dados do Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL ou MongoDB;
Conhecimentos de Git/ GitHub Actions (valorizado);
É valorizado o conhecimento de espanhol ou inglês.




Se a oportunidade corresponde às suas expectativas envie-nos o seu CV para o email catia.carvalho@decskill.com, com a referência “CC/DA”.




A Decskill assume um compromisso de igualdade e não discriminação com todos os seus talentos. Recrutamos e promovemos talento, com base na diversidade e inclusão, independentemente da idade, género, etnia, raça, nacionalidade ou qualquer outra forma de discriminação incompatível com a dignidade da pessoa humana.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Como Business Data Analyst (SQL + PowerBI) te integrarás dentro del equipo Digital Data en el área de Ecommerce de Massimo Dutti.




Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades técnicas, así como una fuerte orientación a resultados y comprensión estratégica del negocio.




Tus responsabilidades:

Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados que permitan evaluar el buen performance de las diferentes áreas de negocio.
Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.




Formación

Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.




Experiencia Laboral

Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.




Skills Tecnológicas

Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.




Skills comunicativas y personales

Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
Interés por el mundo de la moda.




Qué te ofrecemos

Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.




Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

  • Excellent Excel skills

  • Good Power Query skills
  • Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
  • Strong spoken and written English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3 years

Location : Hybrid - Lisbon




Skills Needed?







Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject,
3+ years of experience as data Analyst;
Expertise with Power BI, Tableau, Dataiku, PostgreSQL and ETL tools;
Fluency in English;
The candidate has to be in Lisbon - hybrid position.




Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Expleo is a global engineering, technology, and consulting service provider that partners with leading organizations to guide them through their business transformation, helping them achieve operational excellence and future-proof their businesses.




Expleo benefits from more than 50 years of experience developing complex products in automotive and aerospace, optimizing manufacturing processes, and ensuring the quality of information systems. Leveraging its deep sector knowledge and wide-ranging expertise in fields including AI engineering, digitalization, automation, cybersecurity and data science, the group’s mission is to fast-track innovation through each step of the value chain.




With 19,000 employees and a worldwide presence in 30 countries, our global footprint includes excellence centers around the world. We are in Romania since 1994 and currently counting 1700 colleagues.




Responsibilities




Data Model Management: Develop, update, and maintain the STAFR data model and manage the data sets for the development and operation process.
Data Extraction: Identify and extract relevant data from various sources, including databases, CSV files, APIs, and other systems.
Data Transformation: Clean, normalize, and transform data to ensure it is in a suitable format for the organization’s needs. This may involve data manipulation, joining different datasets, applying statistical functions, and converting data types.
Data Loading: Load transformed data into appropriate storage systems.
Data Validation and Quality Assurance: Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data throughout all stages of the ETL process. Perform quality checks to identify and correct errors or discrepancies.
Documentation: Create and maintain documentation related to data flows and models, transformations applied, and validation procedures.
Data Analysis: Use loaded data to extract valuable insights, generate reports, identify trends, and support data-driven decision-making.
Collaboration: Stay in touch with the Group Data Management in various functions to ensure alignment with recommendations and strategies. Maintain clear and close collaboration with both the development team and the project stakeholders/key users.




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Modeling, Data Science, or relevant experience (2-3 years).
Proven experience in data analysis and ETL processes and tools.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Experience in working with Data Lakes.
Proficiency with SQL and database management.
Good communication and relationship-building skills with stakeholders and team members.
Ability to give and receive feedback; able to listen and share and provide constructive feedback.
ETL Process Automation
English knowledge; French would be a plus
Agile mindset & practices would be a plus




Benefits




Meal Vouchers
Private medical insurance
Performance bonus
Easter and Christmas bonus
Employee referral bonus
Bookster subscription
Work from home options depending on project
Various discounts (7Card, Lensa, World Class & more).
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Accelerate your development and exposure to high performance applications and cloud infrastructure. Join Faptic Technology, a fast-growing scale-up organization with an ambition to be recognized as one of the leading technology companies in Romania.

Our global client base needs builders: engineers and developers who love technology, have deep expertise in software and cloud technologies, and importantly, have a passion for culture and customers.


We obsess about our customers
We build outstanding technical solutions
We create an awesome culture
We accelerate learning and careers


As a Junior Data Analyst, you will join a team who deals with cutting-edge technologies every day and strives to utilize integration services to their limits. You will be taking part in Solution and Architectural designs as well as introducing and proposing new methods and technologies through well tested Proof-of-Concepts. You will Design, develop and deploy pipelines, create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications. You will develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues.

Your activities will include:


Will be working with SQL databases
You will be mentored and have support in further learning and developing your technical skills
Analyze and translate functional specifications /user stories into technical specifications
Research and introduce new technologies and solutions
Implement Proof of Concepts and drive solutions through their full life-cycle
Design, develop and deploy pipelines
Create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications
Develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues
Participate in defining policies & procedures (cloud adoption, write documentations & guides)



Requirements


University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar discipline
Strong organizational, communicational and documentation skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong team player
English is a must


Experience Desirable


SQL knowledge is an advantage
Knowledge of ETL design principles is a plus
Knowledge or previous experience in solution design



Benefits


Private medical insurance 
Training on market trends and client needs 
Continuous personal improvement - 8h/month during work hours 
Lunch on Friday (twice per month, we pay)
21 days annual leave, with one day per year extra up to 25 days 
3 days sick leave without medical proof off
1 day for your Birthday off 
0.5 days Christmas Shopping off 
Competitive salary package
Quarterly fun budget for team events 
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Internship (M/W/N)
Description:
Company Description

Believe is one of the world’s leading digital music companies. Believe’s mission is to develop local artists and labels in the digital ecosystem by providing them the solutions they need to grow their audience at each stage of their career and development.

Its 2,020 employees in more than 50 countries aim to support local artists and labels with a unique digital expertise, respect, fairness and transparency.

To support our fast-growing presence on all continents, we are constantly looking for new Believers to join us and make a stronger and more positive impact on the music industry!

Believe is listed on compartment A of the regulated market of Euronext Paris (Ticker: BLV, ISIN: FR0014003FE9).

Ready to #setthetone with Believe?

Job Description

As a Data Analyst Intern in the Product Team, you will contribute to the success and growth of many artists and labels. Your insights will directly shape the strategies that help artists grow their fanbase and reach new heights in their careers. You'll dive into cutting-edge projects, from developing advanced data models to uncovering viral trends that shape the music industry by analyzing impact of Believe’s partners, including Spotify, YouTube, TikTok, and others...

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Creation and improvement of Power BI Dashboards:
design and develop dashboards to track the performance and accuracy of Tiktok viral trends detection data models,
follow the adoption of Believe products by artist, producers and internal teams,
Conducting Ad Hoc Analyses to support artists making the best decisions to develop their audience at every stage of their career,
Turn your insights into actionable data models that will be integrated into our products, helping artists make informed decisions every day.

Qualifications


Demonstrated interest for the music industry,
studying in last year of a master’s degree from an Engineering or Business school with a specialization in data. Looking for an end-of-studies internship,
previous internship or student experience working with data or analytic topics,
proficient with SQL and visualization tools, Python a plus. Anyway, you are curious and fast learner, you love watching online tutorial until you become expert in a new coding language,
fluent in English, spoken and written. Comfortable working day to day in English


Additional Information

Our interview process is designed to be as transparent and supportive as possible, giving you a chance to showcase your skills and learn more about our team. The process will consist of one HR fit interview, one case study to test analytic skills and two interviews with the team.

Ready to make your mark on the future of music? Apply now and start your journey with Believe!

Set the tone with us

Working at Believe means having individual and collective impact in a fast-growing company!

At all stages of their careers, Believers are an important part of what we are doing: shaping the future of the music industry.

We need teams that truly reflect the diversity of our clients: our international presence is an inspiring and enriching work environment for each one of us, with daily opportunities to connect with our colleagues all over the world.

We have two hearts at Believe - our People and our Artists.

We believe in THE POWER OF OUR PEOPLE, who grow every day to develop their potential… We aim to provide our Believers with the best environment to thrive.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.

Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.

Job Description

As part of a larger Data Team, your primary responsibility will be managing our Unit4 FP&A tool alongside two colleagues. Unit4 FP&A is a comprehensive software solution designed to streamline financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and analytical processes, helping organizations achieve optimal financial performance at a reduced cost.

You will be responsible for collecting, transforming, and modeling data, building reports and dashboards, and ensuring all outputs align with our business goals and financial objectives.

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of business processes, system integration, and technical troubleshooting, while demonstrating strong collaboration and communication skills with multiple stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze, identify, and resolve data quality and integrity issues with strong attention to detail.
Translate business requirements into data-driven solutions to improve financial operations.
Create, maintain, and enhance reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using Unit4 FP&A.
Develop and maintain well-organized data models for efficient analysis.
Integrate data from multiple sources, ensuring seamless data flow across systems and departments.
Provide technical support and training to end users while troubleshooting and resolving data or system issues.



Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Information Technology, Data Analytics).
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, including experience in complex database development, reporting, and automation.
Familiarity with CRM (preferably Dynamics CRM) and ERP systems. Expertise in Power BI or similar BI tools is a plus.
Strong communication skills in English, with excellent stakeholder management abilities.
Strong understanding of ETL/ELT processes.
Proficiency in cleaning, preprocessing, and organizing raw data.
Expertise in visualization tools like Power BI or similar.
Ability to create clear, insightful, and visually engaging reports, charts, and graphs.
Skilled in communicating complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proficient in database systems with the ability to write complex queries.
Experience working with relational and cloud data platforms (e.g., MS SQL, Snowflake).
Ability to work effectively in a team environment, collaborating across departments.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to clearly convey findings.
Capability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines efficiently.
Strong prioritization skills to focus on the most critical analyses.
Ability to keep up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and financial reporting tools.
Proactive in seeking opportunities for skill development and technical advancements.
Adhering to data privacy regulations and upholding ethical standards in all aspects of data handling.



Office: Lisbon, expected onsite presence 2-3 days a week.

Additional Information

Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us.

At Unit4, we offer:


a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful,
balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being,
talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.
Show more

  • a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
  • a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¿Qué estamos buscando? Buscamos un Técnico en Análisis de Datos para Retail - Sector Textil Hogar




Descripción de la empresa:

En Tramas trabajamos para mejorar la calidad de vida en el hogar y el bienestar de las personas, vistiendo con funcionalidad, diversidad y alegría todos los espacios y habitantes de la casa, con productos textiles elaborados a partir de algodón y nuevos materiales a precios accesibles. Tenemos casi 200 tiendas y somos 800 profesionales los que conformamos la compañía.




Nos enfocamos en la calidad y diseño de nuestros productos y la satisfacción de nuestros clientes. Estamos buscando incorporar a un Técnico en Análisis de Datos para optimizar nuestras operaciones de Retail.




Responsabilidades del puesto:

Análisis de datos de ventas y clientes: Interpretar los datos provenientes de diferentes puntos de venta (tiendas físicas y online).
Elaboración de reportes y dashboards: Crear informes periódicos para diferentes equipos (comercial, marketing, stock) utilizando herramientas como Excel, Power BI, Tableau o similares.
Análisis de tendencias de mercado: Identificar patrones en el comportamiento de los consumidores y tendencias en el sector textil hogar.
Optimización del stock y surtido en tienda: Realizar estudios para mejorar la gestión de inventarios, proyecciones de demanda y planificación de surtido en tienda.
Colaboración con otros departamentos: Trabajar estrechamente con equipos de marketing, compras y ventas para proporcionar análisis estratégicos.
Propuestas de mejora: Identificar oportunidades de mejora en las estrategias de pricing, promociones y campañas basadas en los datos.




Requisitos:

Formación académica: Licenciatura en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Economía o carreras afines.
Experiencia previa: Mínimo 2-3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos, idealmente en el sector retail o relacionado.
Conocimiento de herramientas de análisis de datos: Dominio de Excel, bases de datos (SQL), y herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Tableau o similares.
Conocimientos en modelos predictivos: Experiencia en análisis de tendencias y modelos predictivos es un plus.
Habilidades analíticas: Capacidad para interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y proponer recomendaciones basadas en el análisis.
Actitud proactiva y orientación a resultados: Se valorará la capacidad para trabajar de manera independiente y proponer soluciones creativas.




Competencias valoradas:

Capacidad de comunicación: Habilidad para presentar los resultados del análisis de manera clara a diferentes públicos.
Organización y planificación: Buena gestión del tiempo y capacidad para trabajar en múltiples proyectos simultáneamente.
Adaptabilidad y flexibilidad: Capacidad para ajustarse a un entorno dinámico y con cambios frecuentes.




Ofrecemos:

Ambiente de trabajo dinámico en una empresa en constante crecimiento.
Oportunidades de desarrollo y formación continua.
Contrato indefinido con jornada intensiva de mañana durante todo el año.




Formaciones académicas recomendadas:

Grado en Estadística o Matemáticas:
Grado en Ingeniería Industrial o Ingeniería Informática:
Grado en Economía, Administración y Dirección de Empresas (ADE), o Finanzas:
Grado en Ciencia de Datos o Análisis de Negocios:
Formación complementaria o másteres especializados:
Máster en Big Data, Business Analytics o Ciencia de Datos.
Posgrados en análisis de datos o inteligencia de negocios.
Certificaciones en herramientas específicas como Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python o R, que son muy útiles para el procesamiento de datos y la creación de dashboards visuales.




Competencias Técnicas Adicionales a valorar:

Análisis de datos y herramientas de visualización: Excel avanzado, Power BI, Tableau, Google Data Studio.
Bases de datos: SQL para extracción y manejo de datos.
Lenguajes de programación: Python o R, útiles para el análisis estadístico o creación de modelos predictivos.
Experiencia laboral previa en empresas de Retail, tanto en puestos de oficina, como en puestos de tienda.




Condiciones de Contratación:

Tipo de industria de la oferta: Venta al por menor
Departamento: Retail
Nivel: Empleado/a
Horario: 7:00 a 15:15
Salario: Salario: 20.000€ - 28.000€ Bruto/año en función de experiencia demostrable




Ofrecemos:

Jornada intensiva de mañana todo el año
Buen ambiente laboral. Equipo joven, ambiente distendido. Nos gusta juntarnos para celebrar y compartir ocasiones especiales.
Apostamos por la formación continua, dando la oportunidad a nuestros trabajadores de continuar formándose en materias relacionadas con su puesto de trabajo.
Proyecto a largo plazo en plena fase de expansión. Estamos creciendo y queremos construir Equipos de trabajo estable que contribuyan a llevar al negocio a otro nivel. Apostamos por las nuevas tecnologías, en Análisis de Datos y la IA.

Show more

Descripción de la empresa:

  • Contrato indefinido con jornada intensiva de mañana durante todo el año.


Formaciones académicas recomendadas:

  1. Grado en Estadística o Matemáticas:
  2. Grado en Ingeniería Industrial o Ingeniería Informática:
  3. Grado en Economía, Administración y Dirección de Empresas (ADE), o Finanzas:
  4. Grado en Ciencia de Datos o Análisis de Negocios:
  5. Formación complementaria o másteres especializados:
  • Máster en Big Data, Business Analytics o Ciencia de Datos.

  • Certificaciones en herramientas específicas como Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python o R, que son muy útiles para el procesamiento de datos y la creación de dashboards visuales.

  • Lenguajes de programación: Python o R, útiles para el análisis estadístico o creación de modelos predictivos.
  • Experiencia laboral previa en empresas de Retail, tanto en puestos de oficina, como en puestos de tienda.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤩 Build with us

Understanding our users and their behavior allows us to offer the best possible gaming experience, and happy users = happy company. So how do we best understand our

users? By understanding our data!

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who will work in a product team to investigate, understand, and present insights on our data. This figure must be proactive in preempting business needs, with the goal of using data to help the company make better decisions.

This role should combine good business understanding with solid technical/analytics skills, and thus the figure must be able to relate well with product and management.




📖 Your quests will be:

Creating a streamlined and impactful reporting/dashboard structure (our BI tool of choice is Hex)
Defining and assessing the impact & significance of metrics (what to look at, how to look at it, and why it may have changed)
Designing and evaluating experiments (A/B testing)
Guiding the product team in the creation and modification of features based on analyses and trends




🎮 To start playing, you will need:

SQL (and relational databases)
Basic Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib) or R
Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Domo, Looker, Grafana, etc.)
Fluent English




👤 The type of player you are:

Strives to identify and solve problems
Highly analytical
Good communication skills
Desire for self-improvement




👑 Our company values:

Use critical thinking: don't assume, validate your gut feeling!
Take ownership and make it happen!
Love what you do and have fun doing it!
Work on the problem, not just the symptoms!
Don't overcomplicate it, keep it simple and effective!
Share ideas to reduce bias and improve results!







🌈 Power-ups to have more fun

🏡 Smart Working policy

🥳 An innovative, dynamic, and friendly work environment in which you will have the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, thanks to our amazing team

🏢 Amazing HQ office in the centre of Milan (M2 – Stazione Garibaldi)

🇬🇧 English courses provided by a native teacher (related to your English level)

🎤 Monthly Product/Design/Marketing/Tech panels to be aligned with all departments’ results

💻 Amazing workstation with the latest MacBook Pro and a Display Screen (Whatever makes you work better is welcome!)

📄 A top-notch contract proposal

🍽️ Ticket restaurant when working from the office

🍕 Free Coffee & Beer; once a month pizza lunch together

🕙 Flexible work hours

🏄 Internal Team Building events

🛋️ Relax Area with Sofà, Foosball Table, and Board Games




Don't live in Milan? Check out our work model




Building community and having a place to connect with each other is very important for us. We like not only to work together, but to have time to get to know each other, to celebrate and have fun. We also value people's choice to work from anywhere, that's why we have a very flexible hybrid model.




Our policy is 4 days per month at the office, and we decide however we're gonna go. There are people who like to go once every week, or two days every two weeks, four days straight, or even combining the last 4 days of one month with the first 4 days of the next month and only go 8 days straight every two months. Whatever works best for you!




If you don’t live in Italy, we have two options: if you would like to relocate, our company offers a relocation package to help you move to Milan; if you want to stay where you are, we offer a benefit to help you with travel expenses and flexible working hours around your journey time.

Show more
HTML:
🤩 Build with us

Understanding our users and their behavior allows us to offer the best possible gaming experience, and happy users = happy company. So how do we best understand our

users? By understanding our data!

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who will work in a product team to investigate, understand, and present insights on our data. This figure must be proactive in preempting business needs, with the goal of using data to help the company make better decisions.

This role should combine good business understanding with solid technical/analytics skills, and thus the figure must be able to relate well with product and management.


📖 Your quests will be:

  • Creating a streamlined and impactful reporting/dashboard structure (our BI tool of choice is Hex)
  • Defining and assessing the impact & significance of metrics (what to look at, how to look at it, and why it may have changed)
  • Designing and evaluating experiments (A/B testing)
  • Guiding the product team in the creation and modification of features based on analyses and trends


🎮 To start playing, you will need:

  • SQL (and relational databases)
  • Basic Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib) or R
  • Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Domo, Looker, Grafana, etc.)
  • Fluent English


👤 The type of player you are:

  • Strives to identify and solve problems
  • Highly analytical
  • Good communication skills
  • Desire for self-improvement


👑 Our company values:

  • Use critical thinking: don't assume, validate your gut feeling!

  • Love what you do and have fun doing it!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Somos a Glintt Global, uma empresa de matriz portuguesa, líder em tecnologia, com mais de 30 anos de experiência. Pretendemos impactar a qualidade de vida das pessoas através da inovação, tecnologia, do conhecimento e da ambição que nos acompanham. Este é o nosso compromisso!

Para tal, precisamos de ti! Procuramos um Data Analyst para integrar a equipa de Glintt Life- Hospitals- Services, nos nossos escritórios do Porto. Na nossa empresa, terás a oportunidade de aliar todos os teus interesses e competências para nos ajudar a tornar o mundo um pouco mais Glintter!

Como será o teu dia a dia na Glintt?

  • Acompanhamento do cliente;
  • Tradução das necessidades analíticas dos clientes;
  • Análise de requisitos;
  • Modelação e preparação da informação para o perfil do projeto;



O que achamos que precisas de ter?

  • Conhecimentos e experiência em análise funcional;
  • Conhecimentos técnicos em metodologias de levantamento de requisitos, em particular para Data Products;
  • Conhecimentos e experiência no desenvolvimento de Dashboards, Reports, Workflows, UseCases, Data Flows e Process Flows;
  • Conhecimento e experiência em plataformas de BI (PowerBi, Tableau, Metabase, Looker);
  • Conhecimento e experiência de SQL e Python;
  • Conhecimentos e interesse na área da saúde.
  • Conhecimentos e experiência de sistemas de informação da área hospitalar.
  • Visão analítica e rigor;
  • Autonomia, iniciativa e proatividade;
  • Orientação para os resultados;
  • Team Worker.



O que vais encontrar na Glintt?

  • Ambiente de trabalho incrível;
  • Investimento nas tuas competências;
  • Respeito pela tua individualidade;
  • Autonomia e reconhecimento pelo teu sucesso;
  • Instalações preparadas ao detalhe para que te sintas em casa.



Qual o nosso plano para ti?

  • Mentoria;
  • Plano de carreira adaptado às tuas capacidades;
  • Plano de formação individual em soft e hard skills;
  • Participação em projetos desafiantes;
  • Possibilidade de fazer a diferença na vida das pessoas.



Caso ainda não tenhas ficado convencido/a, oferecemos ainda:

  • Workshops e promoção de um estilo de vida saudável
  • Salário fixo e variável
  • Seguro de saúde
  • E muito mais...



E muito mais…

Ficaste entusiasmado/a? Consideras-te a pessoa ideal para esta função? De que estás à espera? Não percas mais tempo e candidata-te a vir ser feliz nesta aventura!

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
At ScaleneWorks People Solutions, we're more than recruiters; we're career architects dedicated to connecting exceptional talent with top-tier opportunities. Backed by industry experts, we prioritize relationships, offer global opportunities, and champion your success every step of the way.

Ready to shape your future? Explore opportunities with us today.




We are looking for a SQL Data analyst, for our well-known client from the IT industry.

Location: Barcelona, Spain

Type of Work: [hybrid] – (3 days WFO), [perm]




Responsibilities:

SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.




Requirements:

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases
Solid Python knowledge
Java is a plus but not essential
Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets
Experience in data modeling for analytics
Familiarity with predictive models
Good understanding of Data Architecture
Experience with Azure products
Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords
Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms




Languages: English (advanced)




Nice to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.




Ready to shape your future? Explore opportunities with us today.




Ready to Take the Next Step? If you're ready to embark on an exciting journey with ScalenWorks, we'd love to hear from you! Submit your resume and let's work together to unlock new possibilities and redefine success.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Ona estamos buscando a un/a Junior Data Analyst para nuestro departamento de Revenue.




¡Estamos en plena expansión y crecimiento!




¿Qué nos diferencia? ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Ona está creciendo muchísimo, es un momento muy bueno para entrar a formar parte de nosotros/as, crecer y construir juntos.
Contrato indefinido e incorporación inmediata.
Oportunidad de desarrollo y promoción interna.
Salario de incorporación: 24.000€ - 26.000 € (según experiencia)
Beneficios sociales: Retribución flexible Cobee, Adeslas a precio reducido, descuentos en nuestros complejos, RCI, descuentos en la plataforma ShoppyClub, entre otros.
Diferentes actividades a lo largo del año: Afterworks, evento de Navidad, etc...
Flexibilidad horaria, entrada entre 8:30 y 9:30; salida a partir de las 17:30. Viernes intensivos.




Serás una pieza fundamental y clave para este departamento, y para Ona.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?




- Mantenimiento de bases de datos (SQL Server y Azure SQL, SSAS).

- Gestión de proyectos de diseño y despliegue de sistemas de información.

- Capacidad para traducir los datos recabados en información de valor.

- Diseño de informes que puedan ayudar al departamento de Revenue en soluciones técnicas y en la toma de decisiones.

- Experiencia en la creación de dashboards y reportes interactivos.




¿Qué necesitamos de ti?




- Estudios universitarios en campos tecnológicos y TI, o Grado Superior con experiencia en el sector.

- Experiencia comprobable en desarrollo y creación de informes.

- Conocimientos en Power BI y SQL.

- Excelente capacidad de comunicación y presentación de informes.

- Trabajo en equipo y colaboración con diferentes departamentos.

- Adaptabilidad y aprendizaje continuo para mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.




Serán altamente valorados:

-Conocimientos comprobables con herramientas del entorno Microsoft Fabric / Microsoft Power Platform.

-Certificaciones en Power BI y/o SQL.

-Transact SQL o KQL.

Title: Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London

• Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training

• Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit

• An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Analyze assets including commercial real estate loans, residential mortgages, auto loans and other cash-flow generating assets

• Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings

• Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems

• Provide senior management with monthly, quarterly and annual updates on the lending portfolio

• Conduct market and asset level research




You have:




• BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)

• 0-3 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm

• Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)

• Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset

• Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English




Team profile:




Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (“DLG”) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.

DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.




About Morgan Stanley




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center.
