Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Dedichiamo tempo e cura alla valorizzazione del tuo talento, investiamo nelle tue competenze e diamo spazio alla tua voglia di metterti alla prova e fare la differenza. Se vuoi crescere insieme a ONIT verso l'obiettivo di essere il miglior partner nell'innovazione digitale, entra a far parte del nostro team!

La certificazione Great Place to Work conferma il nostro impegno per un ambiente lavorativo in cui il benessere e lo sviluppo delle persone sono la priorità, tanto quanto la soddisfazione dei clienti.




Profilo ricercato:




Ricerchiamo una figura di Data Analyst qualificata e proattiva. La persona ideale ha 1-2 anni di esperienza e ha conseguito la Laurea in Informatica o discipline STEM.

Si occuperà di analisi dei requisiti, progettazione e realizzazione di ambienti interattivi per l'analisi dati e creazione di strati semantici per facilitare l’accesso ai dati, anche da parte di utenti non tecnici. Sarà coinvolta in studi di fattibilità, confronto di soluzioni e stima dei benefici, garantendo la copertura funzionale.

Dovrà inoltre produrre documentazione, manuali utente e formare il personale, anche con training on the job. Infine, parteciperà alla sperimentazione di nuovi prodotti, sviluppo di prototipi e valutazione delle nuove tecnologie attraverso analisi costi/benefici.




Skills tecniche:

Modellazione dati di tipo normalizzato per basi dati operazionali e modelli dati per il data warehouse, metodologia e modelli OLAP e ROLAP, tecniche di analisi multidimensionale, linguaggio SQL
Conoscenza di tematiche applicative, best practice e metodologie di analisi, disegno e test in ambito data warehouse, business intelligence e analytics
Conoscenza della piattaforma Qlik Sense per l’analisi e l'elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistica, la realizzazione di strati semantici per l'accesso ai dati da parte di utenti non specialisti
Conoscenza della piattaforma MS Power BI per l’analisi e l'elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistica, la realizzazione di strati semantici per l'accesso ai dati da parte di utenti non specialisti.




Soft skills:

Capacità di lavorare in team e comunicare efficacemente
Capacità analitiche e problem-solving
Curiosità e propensione all’apprendimento costante
Precisione e orientamento all’obiettivo




Cosa offriamo:

Possibilità di smart-working
Flessibilità oraria
Ambiente di lavoro giovane, collaborativo ed innovativo
Academy interna e possibilità di crescita professionale




Essere parte di Onit vuol dire abbracciare valori come onestà, rispetto, equità, trasparenza, fiducia e responsabilità. Questi pilastri sono alla base delle nostre relazioni interne, creando un ambiente in cui ognuno può esercitare la propria attività in modo responsabile e flessibile.

Se ti riconosci nei nostri valori, candidati ora. Ti contatteremo per un primo colloquio conoscitivo o conserveremo il tuo CV per opportunità future.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.

To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...

Job Details

Data Analyst

Join our Unified Marketing Measurement team as a Data Analyst!

In this role, you will use innovative data analytics and data science technology, evolve your skills, and provide our clients with the best-in-class analytical solutions.

We are seeking candidates with experience in a data-related role, open to develop in some programming (SQL) and data modelling techniques.

What You’ll Do…


Data Analysis and Processing: process and validate data sets provided by clients (sales, marketing, price, promotional activities and external / macroeconomic factors).
Analytics and Machine Learning: run marketing mix models with usage of Kantar internal modelling platform to discover patterns and rules determining clients’ sales success and identify weaknesses and bugs in models for resolution.
Internal Collaboration: communicate results of data analysis / modelling to Kantar CS teams, implement feedback from CS teams to improve quality of input data / modelling results.
External Communication: communicate technical information with both technical and non-technical team members and collaborators (also clients).


What You’ll Bring…


Strong numerical skills and exceptional attention to detail required to analyse/transform complex data sets and combine data from different sources.
Some experience with data-related technologies, including database queries, data analysis and eagerness to develop new skills.
Experience in Excel.
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on logical thinking and critical analysis.
Previous experience with MMM solutions (tools / methods) is welcome but not required.


WHY JOIN KANTAR?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Kantar Rewards Statement

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Location

Warsaw, Plac KoneseraPoland

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As an SQL Data Analyst/Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.




Technical Skills

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases,
Solid Python knowledge.
Java is a plus but not essential
Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets.
Experience in data modeling for analytics.
Familiarity with predictive models
Good understanding of Data Architecture.
Experience with Azure products.
Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords.
Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms.




The key elements resource should have:

SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.




Technical Skills:

SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines




Certifications Needed:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Data Analyst




Location - Amsterdam, Netherlandss




Job Description:




Your competencies and experience

• A master’s degree in the field of analytics, mathematics or econometrics

• You have experience with querying languages (e.g., SQL, SAS), and preferably also with dashboarding tools (e.g., Cognos, PowerBI)

• You are analytically strong and have experience in making analyses and sharing results with impact

• You are able to transform data into insights, and present them in an understandable way

• You have a can-do mentality, and you like to quickly learn and apply new techniques

• You are customer-oriented and have experience in using customer and other data to substantiate your decisions

• You can manage stakeholders at different levels, including data oriented and business experts

• You actively ask for help and feedback and you dare to give feedback

Experience with the agile way of working is beneficial for this role.

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
The Company

KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics







Your role at KIKO MILANO

We are looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join KIKO MILANO’s Transformation team, reporting to the Data Analytics Senior Manager.




Such talent will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design and develop BI solutions and provide analytical support.

Your expertise will be crucial in helping the company make data-driven decisions, optimize processes, and identify growth opportunities.




In particular, you will:




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights and support decision-making;
Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms;
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements;
Design and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively;
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support strategic initiatives;
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and BI technologies;
Provide training and support to end-users to ensure they can effectively use BI tools and understand insights.







What you will need to succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role.
Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar.
Strong SQL skills and experience with data querying and manipulation.
Experience with programming languages such as Python is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus.







We would love if you had

Excellent communication and influencing skills with experience of building relationships across an organisation
Strong organisational skills with an ability to re- prioritise as required to meet deadlines
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Highly collaborative style and willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams







KIKO si impegna ad ampliare i propri sforzi per garantire le Pari Opportunità e dedica una particolare attenzione all’integrazione delle persone con disabilità all’interno dell’azienda. Tutte le posizioni aperte in KIKO sono rivolte anche ai candidati appartenenti alle Categorie Protette l.68/99. I dati verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca del Personale. Leggi l'informativa privacy riportata al link https://static.kikocosmetics.com/public/HR/PrivacyCandidati.pdf

Title: Data Analyst | Lisboa
Description:
A Decskill nasceu em 2014 como uma Empresa de Consultoria em Tecnologia da Informação e com a premissa que o seu maior ativo são as suas pessoas. Com o propósito de criar valor através do conhecimento e do talento, a Decskill promove uma cultura de excelência e investe no desenvolvimento e bem-estar dos colaboradores. Com mais de 600 profissionais dedicados e escritórios em Lisboa, Porto, Madrid e Luxemburgo, a Decskill atua hoje em três áreas de negócio:




• Decskill Talent: Acreditamos que as nossas pessoas são fundamentais para o nosso sucesso de todos. Através da Decskill Talent, capacitamos e acompanhamos equipas em desafios da transformação digital dos nossos clientes. Colaboramos com os clientes na sua estratégia de transição digital e inovação, garantindo o sucesso do projeto e o crescimento do negócio.




• Decskill Boost: O nosso compromisso com o talento estende-se a novos modelos de desenvolvimento e colaboração. Dotando a nossa equipa com as mais recentes ferramentas, metodologias e melhores práticas, otimizamos o Time-to-Market e entregamos soluções inovadoras que superam expectativas do cliente.




• Decskill Connect: Na Decskill Connect, a equipa Decskill colabora de perto com os clientes para implementar e gerir infraestruturas de tecnologia da informação que geram valor a longo prazo.




O sucesso da Decskill é construído pelo foco nas nossas pessoas e pela capacidade de enfrentar os desafios da transformação digital com agilidade e flexibilidade. Criamos valor não só para os nossos clientes, mas também para todo o nosso ecossistema onde fomentamos uma comunidade digital dedicada ao crescimento dos negócios através da tecnologia.




Procuramos um Data Analyst para um projeto híbrido em Lisboa.




Responsabilidades:

Criar reports e relatórios técnicos e funcionais;
Capacidade de sintetizar informações e efetuar a transformação, consolidação e simplificação de fontes de dados.




Requisitos:

Experiência prévia na função;
Experiência com SQL para extração de dados do Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL ou MongoDB;
Conhecimentos de Git/ GitHub Actions (valorizado);
É valorizado o conhecimento de espanhol ou inglês.




Se a oportunidade corresponde às suas expectativas envie-nos o seu CV para o email catia.carvalho@decskill.com, com a referência “CC/DA”.




A Decskill assume um compromisso de igualdade e não discriminação com todos os seus talentos. Recrutamos e promovemos talento, com base na diversidade e inclusão, independentemente da idade, género, etnia, raça, nacionalidade ou qualquer outra forma de discriminação incompatível com a dignidade da pessoa humana.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Como Business Data Analyst (SQL + PowerBI) te integrarás dentro del equipo Digital Data en el área de Ecommerce de Massimo Dutti.




Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades técnicas, así como una fuerte orientación a resultados y comprensión estratégica del negocio.




Tus responsabilidades:

Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados que permitan evaluar el buen performance de las diferentes áreas de negocio.
Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.




Formación

Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.




Experiencia Laboral

Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.




Skills Tecnológicas

Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.




Skills comunicativas y personales

Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
Interés por el mundo de la moda.




Qué te ofrecemos

Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.




Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

  • Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
  • Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
  • Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
  • Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
  • Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.


Formación

  • Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
  • Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.


Experiencia Laboral

  • Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
  • Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
  • Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
  • Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
  • Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.


Skills Tecnológicas

  • Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
  • Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
  • Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.


Skills comunicativas y personales

  • Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
  • Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
  • Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
  • Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
  • Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
  • Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
  • Interés por el mundo de la moda.


Qué te ofrecemos

  • Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
  • Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
  • Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
  • InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
  • Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.


Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤩 Build with us

Understanding our users and their behavior allows us to offer the best possible gaming experience, and happy users = happy company. So how do we best understand our

users? By understanding our data!

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who will work in a product team to investigate, understand, and present insights on our data. This figure must be proactive in preempting business needs, with the goal of using data to help the company make better decisions.

This role should combine good business understanding with solid technical/analytics skills, and thus the figure must be able to relate well with product and management.




📖 Your quests will be:

Creating a streamlined and impactful reporting/dashboard structure (our BI tool of choice is Hex)
Defining and assessing the impact & significance of metrics (what to look at, how to look at it, and why it may have changed)
Designing and evaluating experiments (A/B testing)
Guiding the product team in the creation and modification of features based on analyses and trends




🎮 To start playing, you will need:

SQL (and relational databases)
Basic Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib) or R
Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Domo, Looker, Grafana, etc.)
Fluent English




👤 The type of player you are:

Strives to identify and solve problems
Highly analytical
Good communication skills
Desire for self-improvement




👑 Our company values:

Use critical thinking: don't assume, validate your gut feeling!
Take ownership and make it happen!
Love what you do and have fun doing it!
Work on the problem, not just the symptoms!
Don't overcomplicate it, keep it simple and effective!
Share ideas to reduce bias and improve results!







🌈 Power-ups to have more fun

🏡 Smart Working policy

🥳 An innovative, dynamic, and friendly work environment in which you will have the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, thanks to our amazing team

🏢 Amazing HQ office in the centre of Milan (M2 – Stazione Garibaldi)

🇬🇧 English courses provided by a native teacher (related to your English level)

🎤 Monthly Product/Design/Marketing/Tech panels to be aligned with all departments’ results

💻 Amazing workstation with the latest MacBook Pro and a Display Screen (Whatever makes you work better is welcome!)

📄 A top-notch contract proposal

🍽️ Ticket restaurant when working from the office

🍕 Free Coffee & Beer; once a month pizza lunch together

🕙 Flexible work hours

🏄 Internal Team Building events

🛋️ Relax Area with Sofà, Foosball Table, and Board Games




Don't live in Milan? Check out our work model




Building community and having a place to connect with each other is very important for us. We like not only to work together, but to have time to get to know each other, to celebrate and have fun. We also value people's choice to work from anywhere, that's why we have a very flexible hybrid model.




Our policy is 4 days per month at the office, and we decide however we're gonna go. There are people who like to go once every week, or two days every two weeks, four days straight, or even combining the last 4 days of one month with the first 4 days of the next month and only go 8 days straight every two months. Whatever works best for you!




If you don’t live in Italy, we have two options: if you would like to relocate, our company offers a relocation package to help you move to Milan; if you want to stay where you are, we offer a benefit to help you with travel expenses and flexible working hours around your journey time.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
At ScaleneWorks People Solutions, we're more than recruiters; we're career architects dedicated to connecting exceptional talent with top-tier opportunities. Backed by industry experts, we prioritize relationships, offer global opportunities, and champion your success every step of the way.

Ready to shape your future? Explore opportunities with us today.




We are looking for a SQL Data analyst, for our well-known client from the IT industry.

Location: Barcelona, Spain

Type of Work: [hybrid] – (3 days WFO), [perm]




Responsibilities:

SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.




Requirements:

SQL expert, complex querying and also experience in maintaining and deploying databases
Solid Python knowledge
Java is a plus but not essential
Power BI and Excel: Expert in Power BI, particularly in creating and managing datasets
Experience in data modeling for analytics
Familiarity with predictive models
Good understanding of Data Architecture
Experience with Azure products
Clear experience in data science and data analysis rather than just familiarity or buzzwords
Experience with Databricks and other advanced data processing platforms




Languages: English (advanced)




Nice to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus.




Ready to shape your future? Explore opportunities with us today.




Ready to Take the Next Step? If you're ready to embark on an exciting journey with ScalenWorks, we'd love to hear from you! Submit your resume and let's work together to unlock new possibilities and redefine success.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Somos a Glintt Global, uma empresa de matriz portuguesa, líder em tecnologia, com mais de 30 anos de experiência. Pretendemos impactar a qualidade de vida das pessoas através da inovação, tecnologia, do conhecimento e da ambição que nos acompanham. Este é o nosso compromisso!

Para tal, precisamos de ti! Procuramos um Data Analyst para integrar a equipa de Glintt Life- Hospitals- Services, nos nossos escritórios do Porto. Na nossa empresa, terás a oportunidade de aliar todos os teus interesses e competências para nos ajudar a tornar o mundo um pouco mais Glintter!

Como será o teu dia a dia na Glintt?

  • Acompanhamento do cliente;
  • Tradução das necessidades analíticas dos clientes;
  • Análise de requisitos;
  • Modelação e preparação da informação para o perfil do projeto;



O que achamos que precisas de ter?

  • Conhecimentos e experiência em análise funcional;
  • Conhecimentos técnicos em metodologias de levantamento de requisitos, em particular para Data Products;
  • Conhecimentos e experiência no desenvolvimento de Dashboards, Reports, Workflows, UseCases, Data Flows e Process Flows;
  • Conhecimento e experiência em plataformas de BI (PowerBi, Tableau, Metabase, Looker);
  • Conhecimento e experiência de SQL e Python;
  • Conhecimentos e interesse na área da saúde.
  • Conhecimentos e experiência de sistemas de informação da área hospitalar.
  • Visão analítica e rigor;
  • Autonomia, iniciativa e proatividade;
  • Orientação para os resultados;
  • Team Worker.



O que vais encontrar na Glintt?

  • Ambiente de trabalho incrível;
  • Investimento nas tuas competências;
  • Respeito pela tua individualidade;
  • Autonomia e reconhecimento pelo teu sucesso;
  • Instalações preparadas ao detalhe para que te sintas em casa.



Qual o nosso plano para ti?

  • Mentoria;
  • Plano de carreira adaptado às tuas capacidades;
  • Plano de formação individual em soft e hard skills;
  • Participação em projetos desafiantes;
  • Possibilidade de fazer a diferença na vida das pessoas.



Caso ainda não tenhas ficado convencido/a, oferecemos ainda:

  • Workshops e promoção de um estilo de vida saudável
  • Salário fixo e variável
  • Seguro de saúde
  • E muito mais...



E muito mais…

Ficaste entusiasmado/a? Consideras-te a pessoa ideal para esta função? De que estás à espera? Não percas mais tempo e candidata-te a vir ser feliz nesta aventura!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Ona estamos buscando a un/a Junior Data Analyst para nuestro departamento de Revenue.




¡Estamos en plena expansión y crecimiento!




¿Qué nos diferencia? ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Ona está creciendo muchísimo, es un momento muy bueno para entrar a formar parte de nosotros/as, crecer y construir juntos.
Contrato indefinido e incorporación inmediata.
Oportunidad de desarrollo y promoción interna.
Salario de incorporación: 24.000€ - 26.000 € (según experiencia)
Beneficios sociales: Retribución flexible Cobee, Adeslas a precio reducido, descuentos en nuestros complejos, RCI, descuentos en la plataforma ShoppyClub, entre otros.
Diferentes actividades a lo largo del año: Afterworks, evento de Navidad, etc...
Flexibilidad horaria, entrada entre 8:30 y 9:30; salida a partir de las 17:30. Viernes intensivos.




Serás una pieza fundamental y clave para este departamento, y para Ona.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?




- Mantenimiento de bases de datos (SQL Server y Azure SQL, SSAS).

- Gestión de proyectos de diseño y despliegue de sistemas de información.

- Capacidad para traducir los datos recabados en información de valor.

- Diseño de informes que puedan ayudar al departamento de Revenue en soluciones técnicas y en la toma de decisiones.

- Experiencia en la creación de dashboards y reportes interactivos.




¿Qué necesitamos de ti?




- Estudios universitarios en campos tecnológicos y TI, o Grado Superior con experiencia en el sector.

- Experiencia comprobable en desarrollo y creación de informes.

- Conocimientos en Power BI y SQL.

- Excelente capacidad de comunicación y presentación de informes.

- Trabajo en equipo y colaboración con diferentes departamentos.

- Adaptabilidad y aprendizaje continuo para mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.




Serán altamente valorados:

-Conocimientos comprobables con herramientas del entorno Microsoft Fabric / Microsoft Power Platform.

-Certificaciones en Power BI y/o SQL.

-Transact SQL o KQL.

- Experiencia en la creación de dashboards y reportes interactivos.


¿Qué necesitamos de ti?


- Estudios universitarios en campos tecnológicos y TI, o Grado Superior con experiencia en el sector.

- Experiencia comprobable en desarrollo y creación de informes.

- Conocimientos en Power BI y SQL.

- Excelente capacidad de comunicación y presentación de informes.

- Trabajo en equipo y colaboración con diferentes departamentos.

- Adaptabilidad y aprendizaje continuo para mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.


Serán altamente valorados:

-Conocimientos comprobables con herramientas del entorno Microsoft Fabric / Microsoft Power Platform.

-Certificaciones en Power BI y/o SQL.

-Transact SQL o KQL.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Data Analyst!




Responsabilities:

Extract, analyze, and interpret large and complex data sets from various sources.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to support data-driven decision-making.
Work with stakeholders to identify process improvement opportunities through data analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and reliability.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and provide insights to support business decisions.
Stay up-to-date with industry developments and emerging trends in data analysis.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with BigQuery and PostgreSQL.
Experience using data visualization tools, especially Looker.
Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience working in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Desirable: Knowledge of NoSQL databases.
Good level of english.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/DataAnalyst”




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Insights Analyst




Primark exists to serve the ‘Savvy Shoppers’ of the world, creating MAXIMUM JOY AT MINIMUM COST. We make LOOKING GOOD and FEELING GOOD cost less. With a culture of maximum care: for our customers and colleagues, our partners and the planet. With minimum waste, damage or disrespect. We are PRIMARK.




We are a £9bn+ turnover business with operations across 400+ stores and 16 international markets (and growing). Over the past 15 years, we’ve transformed into a true Retail giant with a global footprint that covers 16 selling markets and now employs over 80,000 colleagues worldwide.




We are a newly formed team within Primark, at the start of an exciting journey to integrate insights into the business to drive performance.

Our mission is to drive insight-led decision making for maximum impact in helping Primark achieve its strategic goals.




Our team will be structured in three pillars covering 1) Market, 2) Consumer and 3) Customer Insight. This role will be gathering feedback from our customers in all markets, analysing that feedback and preparing insights to share with the business. This role will be responsible for supporting the market and customer pillars.




What You’ll Get




The world is changing and it’s important we support our colleagues. People are at the heart of what we do at Primark so it’s essential we provide the right environment for you to perform at your best. That’s why we offer benefits that put you first




Some of our benefits are:

27 days of leave, plus bank holidays and if you want, you can buy 5 more.
Flexible Working, opportunity for an early Friday finish, and a subsidised cafeteria.
Primark Perks – Discounts with some local partner business to our offices




What You’ll Do:

In your role, you’ll collaborate with different people across a range of skillsets. Here’s a flavour of your day-to-day:




Market

Utilise market intelligence sources across markets (including consumer panels, data aggregators, trend providers, forecasters, and economic analysts) to build compelling insight stories aligned to supporting Primark’s strategic goals.
Support in building Primark’s capability in understanding market trends and their impact on the long-term market outlook to identify potential threats and opportunities.
Collaborate with product business partners as key partners to the Buying & Merchandising teams to scope category specific analysis.




Customer

Working day to day on our continuous customer feedback programmes.
Analyse data received through customer feedback and identify trends to feed into recommendations that could have an impact on customer experience and commerciality of the brand.
Support in automating and executing customer reports on recurring basis for all channels (In store, Online, Digital etc).




What You’ll Bring

Here at Primark, we want everyone to feel valued – so please bring your authentic self to work, of course with some other key experience and abilities for this role in particular:




Knowledge of the difference between qualitative and quantitative research and when/how to use them.
Problem solver with some experience of gathering and analysing data
Derive insight from data and identifying visual ways to deliver the insight in a compelling story.
Highly organised – can demonstrate strong project management skills and maintain reference documents, logs and processes.
Proactive, dynamic, self starter.
Works well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.




Ready? Good - because we can’t wait to see what you can offer. You’ll be joining a team of diverse, passionate, and talented individuals where you’ll truly belong, collaborating on projects that will shape the future of our industry. If you’re excited about this role but don’t meet all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. You may be the right candidate for this role or another one, and our recruitment team Can determine where your skills may fit in at Primark.




Apply to be part of our future and we’ll help you develop yours.




If you need any reasonable adjustments or have an accessibility requests, during your recruitment journey, such as extended time or breaks between online assessments, a sign language interpreter, mobility access, or assistive technology please contact your talent acquisition specialist.




All offers of employment are subject to background checks, including right to work, reference education and for some roles criminal, and financial checks. If you have any concerns please reach out to our talent acquisition team to discuss

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My retail client within the fashion e-commerce sector in Brussels are looking for an experienced data analyst to join their team. The team work on a variety of business problems ranging from sales, supply chain and planning, so there is lots of scope to grow within the business!




Responsibilities:




- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Requirements:




• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong SQL skills

• Knowledge of GCP and BigQuery is a plus

• Excellent Python skills

• Experience with data visualisation is a plus




Salary Package:




• Up to €75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)

• Meal vouchers.




You can reach me on the following:




Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Phone: +31203997864

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Location: Lyon (Hybrid)

Contract: 12 months +

Start: ASAP

Rate: 375 euros a day gross

Key Skills: SQL | Databricks | PBI | Power BI | Excel | Python | JIRA | Data Management | Data Analysis | Data Visualisation |




Key Responsibilities:




Oversee the recovery and quality of consumption data for billing and the implementation of regularizations (load curves and indexes).
Collaborate on the MDM (Metering, Data, Monitoring) project to define and develop reporting tools for daily monitoring of load curve quality, especially those used in billing processes.
Design and implement tools to retrieve consumption data for calculating annual regularizations in profiled site perimeters.
Diagnose and catalog issues related to retrieving consumption data (load curves and indexes), and coordinate both immediate and long-term solutions.
Streamline and enhance monitoring and resolution processes.
Provide analytical support for complex data exploration and analysis.




Qualifications:




Proficient in SQL-Databricks, PowerBI, and Excel, particularly with advanced functions. Programming skills in Python are a plus.
Extensive experience in data management.
Knowledge of energy supply and the operation of electricity/gas markets is an advantage.
Detail-oriented, organized, pragmatic, and able to work independently.
Strong critical thinking, analytical, and synthesis skills.

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Dans le cadre du développement de l'activité, cette société financière recherche




📈 Un Data Analyst (H/F) 📈




Au sein d'une équipe de 4 personnes, vous aurez en charge :

d'accompagner toutes les directions de l'entreprise (RH, marketing, financière, opérations, ...)
de leur fournir les outils leur permettant de piloter leur activité d'un point de vue opérationnel et stratégique
de réaliser les reportings (performance, financiers, ...)




📊 Vos missions :

Recueil du besoin. Vous n'hésiterez pas à challenger vos interlocuteurs afin de vous assurer de votre bonne compréhension
Analyse et réalisation des analyses statistiques depuis la définition des données en bases, l'élaboration des datalakes, jusqu'à la mise en œuvre des reporting
Présentation des résultats et accompagnement des utilisateurs
...




Votre expérience et prise de hauteur vous permettra de définir les priorités et d'arbitrer les urgences si nécessaires, en lien avec votre manager.




Vous serez force proposition pour préconiser de nouveaux axes d'analyses, de nouvelles améliorations tant fonctionnelles que techniques.




Environnement technique :

SAS, SQL, Tableau, R et autres outils




🤩 Profil idéal :

Bac +5 en Statistiques
Expérience de 3 années minimum sur des fonctions similaires (hors stages & alternance)
Idéalement, connaissance des outils SAS, tableau




🧡 Vous vous épanouirez dans ce poste si vous êtes :

curieux afin d'appréhender la transversalité du poste
force de proposition pour amener de la valeur auprès de vos interlocuteurs métiers
orienté business pour mesurer les enjeux et ainsi arbitrer au mieux les urgences et prioriser les demandes
bon communicant pour vos adapter à vos nombreux interlocuteurs

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Material Bank is a fast-paced, high-growth technology company and created the world's largest material marketplace for the Architecture and Design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to start and manage a design project. Learn more about us at www.materialbank.com or see below.

--

Are you passionate about shaping the future of data ecosystems? We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to be at the forefront of innovation, driving the architecture of our cutting-edge data platform. At Material Bank, you'll play a pivotal role in building a modern data infrastructure utilizing advanced technologies like real-time data streams and machine learning-powered insights.

In this role, you'll integrate various data initiatives into a unified schema, establishing a single source of truth across the organization. Your expertise will be critical in defining universal schemas, rationalizing domain data and structures, and empowering our team to make data-driven decisions. This is a rare opportunity to contribute to both B2B and B2C products, impacting high-profile projects that will shape the future of Material Bank.

What you’ll do:


Perform comprehensive data analysis to assess data quality and derive meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain data dictionaries, ensuring all team members have a clear understanding of data definitions and structures.
Prepare and present detailed reports to the executive team, highlighting trends, patterns, and predictions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data issues, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Participate in efforts to rationalize domain data and data structures to support business objectives.
Utilize various tools and platforms such as SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and Metabase for data analysis and visualization.
Support in the integration of data streams between Commerce Tools and Salesforce OMS using Kafka streams.
Support the development and implementation of the data catalog, tracking schema changes, data lineage, and metadata tagging.
Monitor and alert for data issues, ensuring proactive identification and resolution.



What you’ll bring:


3+ Years of Experience
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights
Proficiency in SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and other relevant data analysis tools
Experience with data visualization
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment



What you’ll get from us:


Our people: If you thrive in an inclusive, innovative, and fast-paced organization, look no further! You will get to work alongside some of the brightest minds - Join a genuinely fun and supportive workplace where we keep our employees consistently engaged through internal communication and corporate events
Relaxation and Celebrations: Generous PTO, Sick Days, Paid National Holidays, and even more (ask us about this when we connect).
Health Benefits: We contribute to your medical, dental, vision and short-term/long-term disability plans and have a strong employee assistance program.
Plan for your Retirement: 401(k) eligible after your first 90 day's employed!
Giving Back: We sponsor multiple events throughout the year to help out our communities. You will receive time off to give back as well.
Growth: We’ll help you take your career to the next level. We want you to be creative and take initiative which will allow you to grow and create within the company. Most importantly, be the best at what matters!
Flexible Work Schedules: With business units and employees across the globe, Material Technologies has embraced a hybrid  working model allowing department leaders to decide on the best approach for their respective teams, whether that be remote, in person, or a little of both.



About Material Bank

Material Bank is the world’s largest material marketplace for the architecture and design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to search and sample materials. Material Bank connects design professionals to hundreds of manufacturers through facilitating brand discovery, rep engagement, and material sampling.

Material Bank has transformed the way an entire industry discovers and samples materials. By removing the friction that exists in the process, we drive business between architects and designers (members) and our Brand Partners (clients).

Our powerful material database and proprietary robotic distribution facility allow members to order samples until midnight (ET) to be delivered free of charge anywhere in the US, in one box, by 10:30 AM the next morning.

Connect with us and discover your career at Material Bank.

--

Material Bank is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or other status protected under any applicable federal, state or local law.
Show more

What you’ll do:

  • Perform comprehensive data analysis to assess data quality and derive meaningful insights.
  • Develop and maintain data dictionaries, ensuring all team members have a clear understanding of data definitions and structures.
  • Prepare and present detailed reports to the executive team, highlighting trends, patterns, and predictions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data issues, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
  • Participate in efforts to rationalize domain data and data structures to support business objectives.
  • Utilize various tools and platforms such as SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and Metabase for data analysis and visualization.
  • Support in the integration of data streams between Commerce Tools and Salesforce OMS using Kafka streams.
  • Support the development and implementation of the data catalog, tracking schema changes, data lineage, and metadata tagging.
  • Monitor and alert for data issues, ensuring proactive identification and resolution.


What you’ll bring:

  • 3+ Years of Experience
  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or a related field
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and other relevant data analysis tools
  • Experience with data visualization
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment


What you’ll get from us:

  • Our people: If you thrive in an inclusive, innovative, and fast-paced organization, look no further! You will get to work alongside some of the brightest minds - Join a genuinely fun and supportive workplace where we keep our employees consistently engaged through internal communication and corporate events
  • Relaxation and Celebrations: Generous PTO, Sick Days, Paid National Holidays, and even more (ask us about this when we connect).
  • Health Benefits: We contribute to your medical, dental, vision and short-term/long-term disability plans and have a strong employee assistance program.
  • Plan for your Retirement: 401(k) eligible after your first 90 day's employed!
  • Giving Back: We sponsor multiple events throughout the year to help out our communities. You will receive time off to give back as well.
  • Growth: We’ll help you take your career to the next level. We want you to be creative and take initiative which will allow you to grow and create within the company. Most importantly, be the best at what matters!
  • Flexible Work Schedules: With business units and employees across the globe, Material Technologies has embraced a hybrid  working model allowing department leaders to decide on the best approach for their respective teams, whether that be remote, in person, or a little of both.


About Material Bank

Material Bank is the world’s largest material marketplace for the architecture and design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to search and sample materials. Material Bank connects design professionals to hundreds of manufacturers through facilitating brand discovery, rep engagement, and material sampling.

Material Bank has transformed the way an entire industry discovers and samples materials. By removing the friction that exists in the process, we drive business between architects and designers (members) and our Brand Partners (clients).

Our powerful material database and proprietary robotic distribution facility allow members to order samples until midnight (ET) to be delivered free of charge anywhere in the US, in one box, by 10:30 AM the next morning.

Connect with us and discover your career at Material Bank.

--

Material Bank is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or other status protected under any applicable federal, state or local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What is Cirkul?

Cirkul is a rapidly growing beverage technology company on a mission to make a healthier world by helping people enjoy drinking more water.

The team at Cirkul developed an innovative beverage delivery system that makes drinking more water delicious, fun, and personalized. The technology reduces the shipping weight of bottled beverages by 96% and uses 84% less plastic. Cirkul offers its customers 100+ unique flavors, all with no sugar, zero calories, no artificial colors, and a range of functional enhancements online, at Walmart, and other retailers across the United States. Hundreds of thousands of consumers are using Cirkul to transition from single-use plastics and sugar-filled beverages to healthier, better-for-you alternatives.

What is this role?

As a Data Analyst for Cirkul, you will be tackling challenges across Growth/Marketing, Finance, Retail, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Customer Support teams to quickly deliver insights through analysis, experimentation and reporting. Additionally, you will develop business processes to scale analytics to support a hyper growth business.

The ideal candidate must be able to roll up his/her sleeves to work independently and own delivery results. He/she must have the ability to prioritize issues under manager’s guidance, deal with ambiguity, seek help when needed and manage conflicting deadlines.

What does an average day look like?

Driving Results


Design and develop KPIs tracking business performance across departments
Build and automate tools to surface key data to stakeholders across a broad range of data literacy levels


Taking Ownership


Monitor KPIs to identify potential opportunities to improve company performance


Making Decisions


Collect, analyze, and explain data to key stakeholders and executive leadership


Cultivating Relationships


Be a data evangelist: collaborate with both technical and non-technical teammates to supplement decisions with quantitative evidence


Instilling Trust


Always auditing: build and maintain processes to track data and troubleshoot errors


Customer Focus


Provide ad hoc analysis and forecasting as needed across a diverse set of teams
Evaluate reporting needs and work with key stakeholders to prioritize overall strategy of the data team in answering company goals


What background should you have?


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Finance or equivalent quantitative degree. Master’s preferred
1+ year of experience preferred
Data-driven, detail-oriented individual with excellent analysis and problem-solving abilities
Fluency in data analysis and data-driven problem solving; a track record of using data to communicate results to key stakeholders
Experience with experimentation and statistical analysis
Excellent verbal and written communication skills: the ability to present complex data in a digestible format to stakeholders of all data literacy levels
Fluency with advanced SQL and Python
Comfortable creating dashboards in a BI framework such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, or comparable tools
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously: superb time management and prioritization ability


What do we offer?


Competitive salary based on experience and market
Generous benefits, 401k match, and PTO (even insurance for your fur babies!)
Employee discounts on Cirkul products
New corporate office space with great amenities
Opportunity to work with a best in class team, in a hyper growth company, taking over the hydration industry
A culture that rewards results


Please review our privacy policy here .

Cirkul, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and are committed to sustaining an equitable and inclusive, people-first environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Skylight is a technology startup based out of Los Angeles and San Francisco. Our mission is to make technology that brings families together. Our founders are former venture capitalists and serial entrepreneurs, who have scaled this business to $100M+ in annual revenue while being completely bootstrapped. We think often about the thousands of smiles we are able to put on our customers' faces each day, and it fills our hearts with purpose. That's why we have been working hard to expand our team and invent, so that we can continue to bring the magic of Skylight to millions of loved ones throughout the world.

We are ready to hire our first Product Data Analyst to lead our center of excellence for data analytics. This role will enable product, engineering, customer service, marketing, and executive teams by providing insightful data analysis, regular reporting, and self-service tools.

Responsibilities:


Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with various teams to identify data needs and methodologies
Project Management: Lead data projects independently, ensuring timely delivery
Data Analysis: Collect, structure, and interpret complex data into actionable insights
Dashboard Development: Create and maintain dashboards to communicate performance metrics
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models to support business functions
Tool Utilization: Use tools like Snowflake, dbt, Fivetran, and Metabase for data management and analysis


Continuous Improvement: Automate processes and optimize data delivery.

Requirements


Experience: 3+ years in a data analyst role; 2+ years with large datasets and enterprise data warehouse solutions
Technical Skills: Expert in SQL and familiarity with data tools like Snowflake, dbt, and Metabase
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills
Project Management: Proven project management skills with a focus on autonomy
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment



Benefits

Our competitive compensation package includes:


Competitive Salary + Equity Package
401K matching
Wellness, learning, and home-office budgets
Health, Dental & Vision Medical Plans
Tremendous autonomy to set the direction of your work
Unlimited PTO
Company holidays on the first Friday of every month (Except November & December)


Equal opportunity employer

Skylight is committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. If you're the best person for the job, we want you on board!

For Colorado-based candidates, the range being offered for this role is $120K-140K based on experience and for California-based candidates, the range being offered for this role is $120K-140K based on experience. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of this law.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Title: Research & Data Analyst
Description:
Museum of Science, Boston

www.mos.org

Innovation and creativity come from the unique perspectives of a diverse staff. We value your perspective.

Summary Statement

The Research and Data Analyst will work in tandem with the Director of research & Data Analytics to create and nurture an effective prospective research and data analytics practice at the Museum of Science. They will use best practices and evolving tools in prospect research and identification to provide impactful information to front-line Advancement staff. The analyst will provide wealth

capacity ratings and synthesized biographical information for prospects suggested by staff, board, or other methods of identification. The analyst will work closely with other members of the Research and Data Analytics team to identify data integrity clean-up projects and support the effective use of the Museum's CRM system.

Responsibilities


In collaboration with the Director of Research & Data Analytics, manage the PM metrics tracking process and ensure accurate data is entered to measure performance.
Attend all event intake and debrief meetings to understand prospect list requirements and briefing material expectations. Lead the prospect briefing research process on behalf of the Research & Data Analytics department
In collaboration with the Director, of Research & Data Analytics and the Associate Director of CRM Management, ensure accurate data in the CRM system and aid in the development of enhanced features that will lead to effective fundraising.
Respond to Prospect Research & Data requests submitted by Advancement staff promptly.
Monitor news outlets to identify potential prospects or inform front-line staff of news associated with their prospects or industries that interest the Museum.
Analyze prospect moves management, reviewing moves activity with gift officers and Advancement lead.


Work Schedule

This position is full-time, 40 hours/wk, Monday-Friday 9-5pm

Hybrid: Required to work from the office Monday, Thursday, and 1 additional day

Reports To

Director, Research & Data Analytics

Minimum Qualifications

Education: Bachelor of Science or Arts Degree

Experience: 2-4 years of related experience (fundraising, prospect research, or other related experience)

Starting Salary

(Exempt) $63,400 to $79,250

Benefits

Benefits for full-time, exempt staff include: free parking, T accessibility, 15 vacation days, 12 holidays, 10 sick days, medical, dental, and vision insurance, short- and long-term disability, life insurance, retirement and savings plan, health care/dependent care flex spending plan, employee discounts, employee referral program, tuition assistance, professional development, direct deposit, free admission, free Duck Tours, discounted movie passes, and much more!

The Museum of Science is fully committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and to attracting, retaining, developing and promoting the most qualified employees without regard to their race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local law. We are dedicated to providing a work environment free from discrimination and harassment, and where employees are treated with respect and dignity.

No phone inquiries, please. Qualified applicants will be contacted within two to four weeks of initial application.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a dynamic and detail-oriented Business Analyst with strong Project Management abilities. This position will work independently, taking ownership of tasks and executing projects with a high degree of autonomy. The ideal candidate will manage multiple initiatives simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and optimal outcomes while balancing both business analysis and project management responsibilities.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Perform detailed data analysis to support decision-making processes within the investment management domain.
Data Governance & Controls: Ensure data governance standards and controls are upheld to maintain data integrity across projects.
User Interaction: Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements, provide updates, and ensure solutions meet business needs.
Communication: Clearly communicate findings, project updates, and solutions with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Investment Management: Support and work with investment management teams to deliver impactful solutions aligned with business goals.
SQL: Write and execute SQL queries (joins, etc.) for data extraction, analysis, and reporting purposes.
Meeting Facilitation: Run and manage meetings, ensuring agendas are followed and actions are clearly communicated and tracked.
Manual Testing: Conduct manual testing to validate project deliverables and ensure quality standards are met.
Project Management: Manage and lead projects, balancing multiple priorities, setting timelines, and delivering within scope and deadlines.

Skills & Qualifications:

Proven experience in data analysis and data governance within a financial services environment.
Strong knowledge of SQL (joins, queries, etc.) and the ability to apply it in real-world scenarios.
Experience in investment management processes and related technology.
Excellent organizational skills, with the ability to run multiple projects concurrently.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, and experience interacting with users and stakeholders.
Ability to work independently, with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Manual testing experience is a plus.
Previous experience running and facilitating meetings.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Please be aware we have noticed an increase in hiring scams potentially targeting Seismic candidates. Read our full statement on our Career's page.

Seismic, a rapidly growing Forbes Cloud 100 company, is the global leader in enablement, helping make sales teams better by becoming more productive and engaging with buyers in a compelling way. Seismic’s platform provides continuous guidance to improve behavior, content, and skills to win more deals and deliver better experiences. Nearly 2,000 organizations including IBM and American Express have made Seismic their enablement platform of choice. Seismic integrates with business-critical platforms including Microsoft, Salesforce, Google and Adobe. Seismic is headquartered in San Diego, with offices across North America, Europe, Australia and China.

Seismic is committed to building an inclusive workplace that ignites growth for our employees and creates a culture of belonging that allows all employees to be seen and valued for who they are. Learn more about DEI at Seismic here.

Who you are:

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst to join our Corporate Data & Analytics team at Seismic. This role is integral to our mission of harnessing data to drive strategic decisions and optimize business operations. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing Tableau dashboards, conducting detailed analyses, and leveraging their knowledge of SaaS GTM strategies to provide actionable insights to Revenue Operations.

What you will be doing:


Tableau Dashboard Development: Design, develop, and maintain enterprise-grade Tableau dashboards to visualize key metrics and support decision-making processes across the organization.
Detailed Analysis: Conduct in-depth data analysis to uncover trends, identify opportunities for improvement, and provide actionable insights to various stakeholders.
Revenue Operations Knowledge: Utilize a deep understanding of Revenue Operations to analyze sales and revenue data, optimize processes, and support strategic initiatives.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams including Sales Operations, Customer Success Ops and Finance to ensure data accuracy and alignment with business goals.
Data Integrity: Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of data by performing regular audits and validations.
Continuous Improvement: Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and visualization to continually enhance the quality of analysis and reporting.


What you bring to the team:


Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on Tableau dashboard and data source development.
Strong knowledge of Revenue Operations and experience working with sales and revenue data, including projects around sales team attainment, pipeline progression, professional services, and/or renewals
Salesforce experience required.
Proficiency in SQL or experience in Snowflake is a plus.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.


What we have for you:


Take time to rest and recharge with generous time off, paid company holidays and end of year company shutdown.
Medical, dental, vision, employer-paid life insurance and disability benefits
Access to Health Savings Account (HSA) with $1,000 Single/$2,000 annual employer contribution
Access to free paid telemedicine and wellness offers through medical plan
Fertility and family planning benefits with financial assistance for adoption and surrogacy
Paid parental leave and family caregiver leaves
Annual professional development reimbursement
Mental health support with 12 free counseling sessions for you and your family members
401k with annual employer contribution
Equity program and performance-based bonuses
Bring Your Own Device technology stipend
Seismic Cares Program with charitable donation matching
Communities of Belonging (employee resource/affinity groups)


We are committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

Seismic’s annual base salary range for this position will vary based on applicant’s location, experience, job level, skills, and abilities as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The range listed below is the minimum to the maximum of our target hiring range.

This position is also eligible to participate in Seismic’s incentive plans in addition to base salary. The actual incentive amount will vary and will be subject to the terms and conditions set in the applicable incentive plan.

Seismic's salary range for this position

$61,200—$105,500 USD

If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the application or recruiting process, please contact us at talent@seismic.com.

Headquartered in San Diego and with employees across the globe, Seismic is the global leader in sales enablement, backed by firms such as Permira, Ameriprise Financial, EDBI, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and T. Rowe Price. Seismic also recently expanded its team and product portfolio with the acquisition of Percolate, Grapevine6, and Lessonly. Our board of directors is composed of several industry luminaries including John Thompson, former Chairman of the Board for Microsoft.

Seismic is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, age, race, religion, or any other classification which is protected by applicable law.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
